SEARCH
Package application

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
application.MainController
@Controller public class MainController extends Object
This program handles HTTP requests to the application, specifically POST and GET.
Author:
Jay Bryant (https://spring.io/guides/gs/accessing-data-mysql/), Sarah Haines, Romina Petrozzi, Yusur Taha, Kyle Piazza-Nickson

  • Constructor Details

    • MainController

      @Autowired public MainController(AssetRepository assetRepository)

    • MainController

  • Method Details

    • getProduct

      @RequestMapping("/products") @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:8080") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> getProduct()
      This method allows for the application of CORS cross origin compatibility with the API.

    • addNewAsset

      @PostMapping(path="/asset/add", consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> addNewAsset(@RequestBody Asset asset)
      This method is a map only for POST requests. It takes the parameters supplied by the user for the asset and inputs it into the database.
      Returns:
      confirmation string

    • getAllAssets

      @GetMapping(path="/asset/find/all") @ResponseBody public Iterable<Asset> getAllAssets()
      This method fetches all the assets stored in the database and returns a JSON file of the content to the web page.
      Returns:
      all assets and their attributes

    • getAssetById

      @GetMapping(path="/asset/find/{id}") @ResponseBody public Optional<Asset> getAssetById(@PathVariable("id") Integer id)
      This method is a query function to request the details of an asset by its Id number in the url localhost:8080/asset/find/{id}.
      Parameters:
      id - of the asset to be queried
      Returns:
      JSON of the asset returned by the id number search

    • deleteAsset

      @RequestMapping(value="/asset/delete/{id}", method={DELETE,GET}) public String deleteAsset(@PathVariable("id") Integer id)
      This method allows for the deletion of individual assets by referencing their id numbers in the url localhost:8080/asset/delete/{id}.
      Parameters:
      id - of the asset to be deleted
      Returns:
      onward path routing for the resultDeleteAsset.html page

    • getAssetExists

      @GetMapping(path="/asset/getAssetExists/{title}/{type}") @ResponseBody public Boolean getAssetExists(@PathVariable("title") String assetName, @PathVariable("type") String typeName)
      This method checks whether a given asset by the same name and type already exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      assetName - of asset
      typeName - of asset
      Returns:
      boolean depending on whether the asset exists

    • getAssetByTitle

      @GetMapping(path="/asset/findTitle/{title}") @ResponseBody public List<Asset> getAssetByTitle(@PathVariable("title") String title)
      This method is a query function to request the details of assets by their title in the url localhost:8080/asset/findTitle/{title}.
      Returns:
      asset list that has assets of the same title as the searched title

    • getAssetByType

      @GetMapping(path="/asset/findType/{type}") @ResponseBody public List<Asset> getAssetByType(@PathVariable("type") String type)
      This method is a query function to request the details of assets by their type in the url localhost:8080/asset/findType/{type}.
      Parameters:
      type - of asset user wants
      Returns:
      asset list that has assets of the same type as the searched type

    • getAssetByLink

      @GetMapping(path="/asset/findLink/{link}") @ResponseBody public List<Asset> getAssetByLink(@PathVariable("link") String link)
      This method is a query function to request the details of assets by their link in the url localhost:8080/asset/findLink/{link}.
      Parameters:
      link - of asset that user wants
      Returns:
      asset that has same link as the searched link

    • getAssetByAuthor

      @GetMapping(path="/asset/findAuthor/{author}") @ResponseBody public List<Asset> getAssetByAuthor(@PathVariable("author") String author)
      This method is a query function to request the details of assets by their author in the url localhost:8080/asset/findAuthor/{author}.
      Parameters:
      author - of asset that user wants
      Returns:
      asset that has same author as the searched author

    • addNewType

      @PostMapping(path="/type/add", consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> addNewType(@RequestBody Type type)
      Post request to fetch type data from UI form and add it to the database.
      Parameters:
      type - type object to submit
      Returns:
      response entity depending on outcome

    • addNewType

      @PostMapping(path="/type/add") @ResponseBody public String addNewType(@RequestParam String type, @RequestParam String customAttribute1, @RequestParam String customAttribute2, @RequestParam String customAttribute3, @RequestParam String customAttribute4)
      Path to add types to the database using parameters. Used by loading scripts.
      Parameters:
      type - name of type
      customAttribute1 - type attribute
      customAttribute2 - type attribute
      customAttribute3 - type attribute
      customAttribute4 - type attribute
      Returns:
      confirmation string

    • getAllTypes

      @GetMapping(path="/type/find/all") @ResponseBody public Iterable<Type> getAllTypes()
      This method fetches all the types stored in the database and returns a JSON file of the content to the web page.
      Returns:
      all types and their custom attributes

    • getTypeById

      @GetMapping(path="/type/find/{id}") @ResponseBody public Optional<Type> getTypeById(@PathVariable("id") Integer id)
      This method is a query function to request the details of a type by its Id number in the url localhost:8080/type/find/{id}.
      Parameters:
      id - of the type to be queried
      Returns:
      JSON of the type returned by the id number search

    • getTypeByName

      @GetMapping(path="/type/findName/{typeName}") @ResponseBody public Optional<Type> getTypeByName(@PathVariable("typeName") String typeName)
      This method is a query function to request the details of a type by its name in the url localhost:8080/type/find/{typeName}.
      Parameters:
      typeName - of the type to be queried
      Returns:
      JSON of the type returned by the name search

    • getTypeExists

      @GetMapping(path="/type/getTypeExists/{typeName}") @ResponseBody public Boolean getTypeExists(@PathVariable("typeName") String typeName)
      This method checks whether a given type by the same name already exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      typeName - name of type
      Returns:
      boolean depending on whether the type exists

    • deleteType

      @RequestMapping(value="/type/delete/{id}", method={DELETE,GET}) public String deleteType(@PathVariable("id") Integer id)
      This method allows for the deletion of individual types and corresponding assets by referencing their id numbers in the url localhost:8080/type/delete/{id}.
      Parameters:
      id - of the type to be deleted
      Returns:
      confirmation string

    • addActionLog

      @ResponseBody public String addActionLog(@RequestParam Integer assetId, @RequestParam Integer typeId, @RequestParam String action)
      This method is a map only for POST requests, It takes the parameters for the action log and inputs it in to the database.
      Parameters:
      assetId - reference id for the asset being recorded in the log
      typeId - reference id for the type being recorded in the log
      action - what task was being undertaken on that item id (such as: deleted)
      Returns:
      confirmation string

    • getAllLog

      @GetMapping(path="/log/find/all") @ResponseBody public Iterable<ActionLog> getAllLog()
      This method fetches all the action logs stored in the database and returns a JSON file of the content to the web page.
      Returns:
      all the action logs and their details

    • getLogById

      @GetMapping(path="/log/find/{id}") @ResponseBody public Optional<ActionLog> getLogById(@PathVariable("id") Integer id)
      This method is a query function to request the details of an asset by its Id number in the url localhost:8080/asset/find/{id}.
      Parameters:
      id - of the log entry to be queried
      Returns:
      JSON of the action log to be returned by the id number search

    • getAllComment

      @GetMapping(path="/comment/find/all") @ResponseBody public Iterable<AssetComment> getAllComment()
      This method fetches all the asset comments stored in the database and returns a JSON file of the content to the web page.
      Returns:
      all the asset comments and their details

    • getCommentById

      @GetMapping(path="/comment/find/{id}") @ResponseBody public Optional<AssetComment> getCommentById(@PathVariable("id") Integer id)
      This method is a query function to request the details of an asset by its Id number in the url localhost:8080/comment/find/{id}.
      Parameters:
      id - of the comment entry to be queried
      Returns:
      JSON of the asset comment to be returned by the id number search

    • addNewComment

      @PostMapping(path="/comment/add", consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> addNewComment(@RequestBody AssetComment comment)
      Post request to fetch comment data from UI form and add it to the database.
      Parameters:
      comment - from user
      Returns:
      response entity depending on outcome
